history.content: The consensus advice from faculty in EECS and Stat is that everyone who has taken 70 should take 126. That is the core probability course for EECS and LSCS majors.

children.subject: Currently taking CS 170 and EE 126. IMO, if you're interested in probability, and especially if you're interested in communications/networks and AI/ML, you should take it. It's harder than CS 70, but you build a lot of problem solving skills as it relates to probability. As for the combined workload, it's basically two CS 70s.

I got a B+ in 70 and I’m interested in probability. I understand that everyone who takes 126 will be very good at 70’s material and will probably set the curve very high. Would 126 be a recommended course for someone in my position? 

Although I hate the idea of avoiding courses because of GPA, I sometimes have to consider the practicality of this “strategy”.

history.content:
Hi, I'm thinking about taking CS170 and a probability course next semester. I'm not sure whether to take STAT134 or EE126 because I've heard that EE126 covers more material but is harder. Any thoughts on which class to take?

I'm also planning to take COGSCI1 and a language course along with these two.

Any advice would be appreciated.
history.subject: Course Advice: CS170 + STAT134/EE126?
